discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When the switch cam table is full, the switch will now behave like a hub broadcasting all the frames in the network.
machan meka answer A bro because When the Content Addressable Memory (CAM) table in a switch becomes full, it is unable to map new MAC addresses to their corresponding physical ports.
A. Switch then acts as hub by broadcasting packets to all machines on the network

choices.D: Every packet is dropped and the switch sends out SNMP alerts to the IDS port A
choices.B: The CAM overflow table will cause the switch to crash causing Denial of Service
choices.A: Switch then acts as hub by broadcasting packets to all machines on the network
choices.C: The switch replaces outgoing frame switch factory default MAC address of FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF

questions.answer_description:
The following ports are associated with file sharing and server message block (SMB) communications:
✑ Microsoft file sharing SMB: User Datagram Protocol (UDP) ports from 135 through 139 and Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) ports from 135 through 139.
✑ Direct-hosted SMB traffic without a network basic input/output system (NetBIOS): port 445 (TCP and UPD).
References: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/298804
questions.question_text:
You have successfully gained access to your client's internal network and successfully comprised a Linux server which is part of the internal IP network. You want to know which Microsoft Windows workstations have file sharing enabled.
Which port would you see listening on these Windows machines in the network?

comments.content: Piggybacking is when you enetring a organization with permition of another authorized/legitimate person, tailgating is when you do this without knowledge or without asking authorized/legitimate person. There is not better choice then piggybacking so this is a best answer
It is the right answer, however piggybacking is the only option that is correct as well

discussion.content: And what about Tailgating is the right answer to this question.

questions.answer_description:
In security, piggybacking refers to when a person tags along with another person who is authorized to gain entry into a restricted area, or pass a certain checkpoint.
References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piggybacking_(security)
questions.question_text:
Jimmy is standing outside a secure entrance to a facility. He is pretending to have a tense conversation on his cell phone as an authorized employee badges in.
Jimmy, while still on the phone, grabs the door as it begins to close.
What just happened?

questions.answer_description:
chntpw is a software utility for resetting or blanking local passwords used by Windows NT, 2000, XP, Vista, 7, 8 and 8.1. It does this by editing the SAM database where Windows stores password hashes.
References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chntpw
questions.question_text: You've gained physical access to a Windows 2008 R2 server which has an accessible disc drive. When you attempt to boot the server and log in, you are unable to guess the password. In your tool kit you have an Ubuntu 9.10 Linux LiveCD. Which Linux based tool has the ability to change any user's password or to activate disabled Windows accounts?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
What is Netcat used for?
Netcat functions as a back-end tool that allows for port scanning and port listening. In addition, you can actually transfer files directly through Netcat or use it as a backdoor into other networked systems.
Correct, the first thing you want to do is ensure you can maintain access by creating a separate account.
I would say D (=maintain access by installing app)

questions.question_text: After trying multiple exploits, you've gained root access to a Centos 6 server. To ensure you maintain access, what would you do first?
